review_text: We loved our stay at this beach cottage. It was perfect for our family of 4, including 2 older teenagers. The view is amazing and we loved sitting on the bench in front of the cabin to gaze at the beach and ocean. The location was great. An easy walk to shops, restaurants, and beach access. The neighborhood is so close to everything in Newport but quiet. The cottage had everything we needed and was very clean. We made a simple meal while we were there and had everything we needed. Gina was very responsive and worked with us to make check-in and check-out easy. We will be back again!

review_text:
This is our second visit to the Beach Bum Cottages. The view from the living room window is AMAZING...so even if it's raining and windy, you can sit inside and watch and listen to the waves. If it's dry, there's a little bench outside that keeps you warm in the radiant sunshine.
It's super cozy and cute.
The beds are comfortable. We were there for almost a week and our back didn't hurt. (YAY!)
The kitchen is small but very functional and well stocked. We cooked several meals and ate looking at the ocean.
It's a short walk to a paved trail down to the sand. You can walk all the to the Agate Beach area or you can walk to the Harbor.
The Nye Beach area is quaint and not as commercial as the rest of Newport.
THANK YOU for a great stay! I am confident we will be back.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This cottage was amazing. We loved the vintage feel of the space, the incredible picture window with a view of the Pacific Ocean that will never disappoint. The owner takes great pride in her home, and it shows. If you want to visit Newport, historic Nye Beach is the place to be located. You will be able to easily and quickly walk to many wonderful restaurants, shops and the beach is just steps away. Off street parking was great, and the area felt very safe and secure.
We stayed 3 nights and was honestly sad to leave. The space is perfect for two, but it could also easily accommodate a third traveler (just note as another reviewer indicated there are no doors on the bedrooms - which was not a problem for us!) If we were to return to the area, we would love to book this cottage again - for us it was perfect and exactly as advertised.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: All the expectations were met from the minute we arrived! Convenient private parking, easy access, very neat and clean, and we were absolutely blown away by the view in #7! What a beautiful place to stay on our mini vacation! There were so many things to see just by walking a short distance in and around Nye Beach... but we spent most of our days taking long walks up and down the beach, and then returning to our cozy retreat in the evening, playing guitar, reading books and enjoying delectable meals from our local finds in Nye Beach. We also took a short drive to Yaquina Head Lighthouse, then down to visit shops-n-sea lions down on the bay front, stopped for some fish-n-chips, and had to sample some decadent chocolate from the confectionery. As we began our drive home, we felt refreshed and ready for the coming week, fondly reminiscing, and thinking about when we will make our next visit!

I had the best vacation of my life. The bungalow was everything I could have asked for. AND THE VIEW from the bungalow was to die for. They thought of every detail possible. From a stocked kitchen utensils, to amazing bedding (so important after a long day of exploring), there is nothing that they have not thought of. The cabin was so clean and comfortable. We relaxed our first night and ordered Abbeys Legendary Pizza. OMGOSH.
Sitting in that dining room window, drinking some wine, and eating that phenomenal pizza, with the view will make your stay worth while.
I am from Nebraska, this vacation made my entire life. Iâ€™ve only dreamed of a vacation like this. I couldnâ€™t be more life fulfilled after staying at their bungalow. The town is great, the food was PHENOMENAL, and the attractions are everywhere! We even saw whales (from the bungalow and at Depoe Bay)!
I promise you that you wonâ€™t have any qualms after staying here! Thereâ€™s nothing that will compare. It was amazing. And I even cried a little when I had to leave.
Total 5 stars. Iâ€™d leave a 5 star every day of the stay if I could.
I will be back next summer for sure.

review_text: This is the best place I've stayed on the Oregon Coast. You're literally right on the water, and wake up to a beautiful view of the mighty Pacific. We drove in from Portland, but didn't need a car the entire time we were there. There's a grocery store right up the street and it's super close to a bunch of adorable shops, great restaurants, and getting down to the beach. Highly recommend going to check out the Yaquina Lighthouse, which you can see from the Cabin. It's about a 5 minute drive and costs $7 to see the whole area, which includes gorgeous tidal pools. P.S. If you have a National Parks pass, the Lighthouse is free!

review_text:
Nice, clean cottage in a great location. I've stayed in other cottages in this complex before and enjoy the location and the dog-friendliness. This cottage was very dark - there are no lights in the main living/dining area - only over the kitchen counters along the back wall. There's a nice ceiling fan over the couch but it's not a model that has a light included. My daughter was excited to see the jigsaw puzzles in the cottage but with no light at all in in the dining nook it was too dark in the evenings to do anything at the table or even at the coffee table in the living room.
Kitchen was clean and nice size. It's a little more bare-bones than other airbnb's I've stayed at. We couldn't find a baking sheet and only a small pot for cooking pasta. Bed was comfy and we enjoyed the little deck with chairs off the bedroom. There's even a little peek-a-boo view of the ocean if you look closely. Wish the checkout time were a little later. 10am is earlier than many other places

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The house is situated close to everything Nye Beach has to offer, within walking distance. We visited for the Newport Marathon, and the Start Line was only a 1.1 mile walk. Plus, it's right on the course through the Nye Beach section, so my wife got to cheer on our entire team, just about 50 steps out the door. The area is close enough to highway 101 for larger stores or other needs, but very quiet when coming back to relax or when sleeping at night. We had a few teammates stop by after the race, and all of them wished they'd found a place like this. Everything in the house worked as expected, and the provided amenities and consumables were more than adequate. We also enjoyed the fact that our unit had a small but cozy and relaxing deck off the bedroom. We'd definitely stay here again for it's proximity to Nye Beach, and it's location just close enough to downtown Newport, but much quieter.

review_text: I am a former resident, so I was familiar with the neighborhood, and all my favorite restaurants are walkable. I intend to return and am looking forward to checking out the other units on the property. There are two things I would recommend for Cottage A. Better lighting over the table for card players, and a warning label on the bubble bath. This jetted tub is as deep as I have experienced and I swear I put in a tiny bit of the product supplied by the hosts (all great) and then had to fight the foam when I turned on the jets. It was comical, never overflowed, and no one to take my â€œlike a movieâ€ moment. I would suggest less than half a teaspoon, if you want to enjoy the jets for any length of time, before you have to turn them off. My friend from Bend told me about these units, and she was right. Praise worthy, and affordable. We will be back.

The very spacious kitchen was great for preparing dinner after a full day of exploring, and the fantastic gas stove in the living room was a definite highlight. review_text:
Absolutely a fantastic cottage that is located a quick five minute walk to the beach, downtown Nye beach, and 45 minutes to Lincoln city.
This cabin was dog friendly, they even provided dog bowls for food and water, chair covers in case your pooches jump up on the furniture, and the bed was extremely comfortable. It was well accessorized and a very pretty home with a lot of cute decor. The enclosed gas fireplace in the living room was amazing, and had all the advantages of your own fireplace, minus having to light it, add wood, or worry about smokeâ€” it kept us super warm while it was snowing, and it also made us feel like we were in the mountains sitting next to a warm fireplace.
The cottage also had all of the channels you could need on its Roku TV: Netflix, Amazon prime, Apple TVâ€” plenty to watch and keep us busy when it was snowing outside.
Also, Plenty kitchen Necessities needed to cook your own meals, and very clean. All in all this is one of the best air BNBs Iâ€™ve ever stayed in. (This was my second time staying in these cottages, and this one was even better than the first one. We will be back!)

review_text: I wish I could give 6 stars! Even 10! Absolutely the best stay Iâ€™ve had anywhere ever. This place is beautiful even beyond what the pictures capture. The unit itself was spotlessly clean, smelled great, beautifully furnished, the perfect space for our 3-person party. The site is amazingly private - a quarter-mile trail loop in the back thatâ€™s easily walkable but not trampled-through like many public trails can be, and the woods themselves were gorgeous. The location was perfect - right across the road from Moolack beach, which isnâ€™t crowded at all, and under a 10 min drive to downtown Newport. Walter was an amazing host - communicative, accommodating, extremely helpful, friendly and happy to talk, and even cleared out the fire pit and set it up for us to use! We will be coming back many times, and if youâ€™re wondering if this is the spot for you: it is, book it now!

We booked this place for a weekend getaway with our dogs and it was fine. The location is great and it was easy to find, walkable to the beach, restaurants, etc. it was pretty clean, though I did find a can of chew on the floor. The communication is a little inhospitable, we were told not to even ask for an early check in or late checkout, and warned to keep our dogs on leashes at all times AND that there was a camera, ostensibly to see if we werenâ€™t. Of course we are more than happy to abide by the rules, keep our dogs leashed, etc. but feeling like we are under surveillance isnâ€™t a great welcome. I guess they must have had problems in the past.
It is affordable, quiet, and has everything you need for a short stay.

April 2024
,
Â·
Stayed with kids
review_text: I had an April getaway with my young daughter and we loved staying here. The nautical theme of the whole complex was really fun & our unit (#6) was warm and cozy. There was an additional fan and space heater for the varying spring temperatures, which was helpful. There was great water pressure and responsive hot water in the shower and the sinks. We had everything we needed to support cooking meals in the kitchenette & Gina even leaves out a snack basket and coffee for guests to have. She was extremely responsive and helpful to a few questions I had. The location is awesome- walkable to parks, the beach, shops and restaurants. Plus the constant sound of the ocean waves and cool breeze coming off the water just added to the peaceful, beachy vibes. We would definitely stay here again!

I used to live in Newport so Nye Beach is close to everything I came to see including great friends. The weather was as always a little of everything and gorgeous. Plenty of hiking, eating and shopping for a great few days away from the office.

,
Â·
Stayed about a week
review_text:
There is a lot to recommend this sweet little bungalow. It's clean, well stocked & Gina was very responsive. The location is great, easy walking distance to the beach & half a dozen excellent restaurants, bakeries, coffee cafes. Plus, quick vehicle access to the Bay Front, Coast Hi. & everything the coast has to offer.
Two things made our stay less than five stars:
The metal frame of the pullout couch is quite prominent through the thin mattress. It protrudes uncomfortably against backbone and ribs.
The bungalow has a gas fireplace. We didn't need it in summer, but it's probably wonderful in the winter. The prob is, even in the off position it emits heat; the thermostat was set at 55, but registered 75 as the day went on. When we were present in the afternoon/evening we found ourselves leaving the exterior door open to cool the room down.
The bed in the bedroom was very comfortable; great mattress, quality linens, & a bedroom window that opens to the sounds of the waves.

Gina's place worked out perfectly for the two of us: I had the master bed, and he had the pull-out couch, which was very comfortable. Gina's cabin had everything necessary for a comfortable stay, and more. We enjoyed the books about the area, the recommendations in the binder, the coffee available in the kitchen and nice soap/shampoo in the bathroom. It was lovely to walk a few block to go pick up breakfast while my son lounged in bed, and to walk to the beach in 3 min. It was fun to see, perched on the bluff, the fires lit up on the beach when dusk fell. We had a great stay and would stay at Gina's cabin again. Thank you!

I can't wait to rent out the whole compound for a family get away!!

We shared a five course meal after following the smell to Pacific Kitchen and giggled at the corner table until people started to stareâ€¦ delicious even if we did miss the ribeye. We gazed and talked and connected and breathed life into weary bodies. We â€˜metâ€™ Gina and learned of her familyâ€™s history. We listened to the waves. We listened to each other. We rolled dice and rolled our eyes and rolled on the floor like best friends wrestling on the ground. We spoke of the future and of the past as though the two were connected by usâ€¦ We chose love. We chose sleep and laughter and longing. We chose fun and familiarity. And now we choose to do it thousands more times. If you can swing it, stay here with someone you adore. You wonâ€™t regret it.

The kitchen area is small in space but has an extensive amount of useful kitchen tools (like spatulas and a hand can opener, etc.) as well as many items directly food related (salt and pepper, organic cooking oil, tea bags, coffee, etc.)
The bed is very comfortable. The windows downstairs and upstairs open to allow the evening light breezes and seaside air inside to refresh and embellish the living spaces. Bath towels are plush and are plentiful. She has even provided additional towels for beach use. And the parking space is directly in front of the rental to allow ease of transferring your belongings into/out of the property--that feature is very convenient.

We were in town for a wedding and looking for a cheaper alternative than the $300 a night hotel that was setup by the bride and groom. I found Dana's place about 8 months in advance and she was really responsive to my brief questions. She also sent directions to the space several months in advance. Once we were in the space, she responded to communication within minutes of a message.
The space itself is great with all the amenities promised and more. It was the perfect accommodation for our brief stay. It is only a few blocks from the beach and a downtown area. We spent every morning walking on the beach before the wedding festivities.
Overall, this was a 5 star space that had a great location, price, and amenities included. It was the perfect spot for our brief trip to the Oregon Coast!

We were offered an early check in which was awesome! Entering the unit was easy and the first thing that caught our eyes, was the view! We quickly made our way to the beach which was easy. We also enjoyed being able to do dinner and breakfast at the condo as all of the kitchen amenities were available. We loved it so much and hope to visit again in the future.

review_text: This studio condo has itâ€™s own vibrant soul and was perfect for my wifeâ€™s birthday weekend getaway. The location is exceptional; itâ€™s within walking distance to a bunch of amazing shops, restaurants, and markets. The guest book has characterâ€”reading through some of the experiences others had can give people new to the area ideas. Although the host does a great job at communicating favorite places nearby in the welcome booklet inside the condo. The kitchen is fully stocked with everything youâ€™d need if you were planning on cooking during your stay. The shower was refreshing and had good water pressure, the bed was comfortable, and the view was amazing. Sleeping to the sound of the waves was darn near therapeutic. I would highly recommend this studio condo, and if itâ€™s available next time we visit Newport, weâ€™ll be staying here again. The hosts were great and communicated very well with nearly instant response time. If I could rate the place higher I would. We loved our stay!!!

review_text:
Some people may think this unit is a bit on the small side, but my partner and I felt it was the perfect. Of course we both spend a lot of time in New York City in tiny accommodations, so that may expose our bias.
We loved everything about this unit - beachfront location, clean, well-appointed, super-comfy bed, easy check-in, great balcony views, fairly quiet (except for a number of dog-barking episodes in a nearby unit, which made us wonder why it didn't drive the dog's owner nuts too).
What we really appreciated most was the size and layout. Perfect for two, HUGE kitchen, but the bed is the unit's central feature, great for enjoying the ocean views/sounds and watching TV.
Would stay here again. Highly recommended.

review_text: We just returned from 3 nights at Sea Grass Studio and it was the perfect birthday celebration getaway weekend! The location is great - within a few blocks of the cafes, restaurants, and shops in Nye Beach. The views from the condo are fantastic! We slept with the windows open and listened to the waves crashing all night - just lovely! A short walk down the stairs and you are on on the beach and can walk for miles in either direction....perfect for running too! The condo had a fully stocked kitchen with everything you need. Bathroom was nice (great shower!), king bed was comfortable, and they provided throw blankets for curling up on the balcony on cool days (it is the Oregon coast after all!), beach towels, beach chairs...everything you need! We would stay there again in a heartbeat!

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This is a really nice unit with fantastic location and view! Your are right on the beachfront with the direct access to the beach. You can watch the crashing waves from inside the unit (especially when cold and windy) and see Yaquina Head Lighthouse from the balcony. The unit is furnished very tastefully with high end items. Everything is thought of, to make it comfortable and convenient for the guests - including the Nespresso machine with the pods. The shower and the water pressure is wonderful:) Location-wise is only two minutes to Nye Beach cafes and restaurants and only few minutes drive to the bay front. I truly enjoyed my stay despite it was cut short by one night due to some flight disruptions. Highly recommended and you wonâ€™t get disappointed!

December 2021
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Really great place to stay on the coast! The studio was very clean and we loved how it was fully stocked (pots, pans, dishes, silverware, plenty of towels, detergent, even down to flashlights.) It seemed like they thought of every detail to make a great stay. only recommendations we have are maybe a fan available or an updated AC unit as we had issues adjusting it. it was set on 50 (lowest) but very hot like the heater was on and we couldn't figure out how to adjust it. We also couldn't sign the guest book because we didn't have any pens or pencils to write with and we couldn't find any either! so sad we missed out on that. But overall we had such a great time and I would definitely return and recommend to my friends and family!
